section.p:
A subdivision can be removed from the school structure by using either one of the following methods:
Select SubdivisionDelete from the main menu.
Press the Delete subdivision button on the toolbar.
Select appropriate item from the subdivision context menu in either tree or panel view.
Use the Ctrl + Alt + D keyboard shortcut.
A subdivision window in delete mode (see ) or a confirmation prompt will appear to the right of the tree view panel, depending on the invocation method. Confirm or cancel the operation.
section.note: Once deleted, the subdivisions are lost forever. Associated students, however, will be filed in the archive. You can restore students from the archive to another subdivision, or clean the archive manually.

When Dialog Nibelung StudDB is running in the deferred write mode (see ) the operations are actually performed only when Save database function is invoked, or the autosave option is activated in database settings (see ).
